intro: Satureja alpina subsp. meridionalis, commonly known as alpine savory, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and square stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
